notes: The projectile travels at a speed of 1500.
Roots the target, preventing it from moving and casting certain mobility spells. Provides True Sight over the target, but only when the target was not invisible or within a fade time upon hit.
Provides True Sight over the target, but only when the target was not invisible or within a fade time upon hit.
Affect units in fog, but does not provide vision.
Successive casts on the same target do not stack, but refresh the duration instead.
abilities.description: Roots all enemies in a target 450 radius for 2 seconds and deals 220 damage.
itemBehaviour:
(Spell_immunity_block_symbol)^Does not pierce spell immunity
Root persists if debuff was places before spell immunity and when not dispelled.

notes: Does not stack with the Chain Lightning of Maelstrom, Mjollnir or other Gleipnirs.
When obtaining multiple items with the Chain Lightning ability, only the one that has been continuously the longest in the inventory works.
The lightning bounces in 0.25 second intervals, so hitting max targets takes 0.75 seconds.
Can proc on fogged or invisible units, but will not bounce toward fogged or invisible units.
Can never hit the same unit more than once per proc.
All bounces together can deal up to 640 damage (before reductions).
Chain Lightning can proc while a previous chain lightning is still bouncing.
Chain Lightning will not proc if the attacker is dead. However, it can proc if the target is dead.
However, it can proc if the target is dead.
Attacks which proc Chain Lightning cannot miss.
The Gleipnir buff is a hidden buff required for the lightning to jump.
Chain Lightning does not use a regular cooldown. It is neither displayed on the item icon when proccing, nor is it affected by cooldown manipulating effects.
abilities.description: Grants a 30% chance on attack to release a bolt of electricity that leaps between 4 targets within a 650 radius, dealing 160 magical damage to each. Lightning proc pierces evasion.

name: Gleipnir
description: Bindings forged by impossible means to leash an ancient evil.
trivia: In Norse Mythology, Gleipnir is the chain that is used to bind Fenrir, a wolf that is the son of Loki and Angrboda.
